Name: Adaptability
GameText: Powers up moves of the same type as the Pokémon.
EffectDetail: Increases the Same Type Attack Bonus from *1.5 to *2.

Name: Aerilate
GameText: Normal-type moves become Flying-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
EffectDetail: Increases the power of Normal-type moves by 20%. It then changes those moves to Flying-type.

Name: Aftermath
GameText: Damages the attacker if it contacts the Pokémon with a finishing hit.
EffectDetail: The foe that dealt the final hit loses 1/4 of its maximum HP if the move made physical contact.

Name: Air Lock
GameText: Eliminates the effects of weather.
EffectDetail: All weather effects are negated while the Pokémon is on the field.

Name: Analytic
GameText: Boosts move power when the Pokémon moves last.
EffectDetail: Attack power increases by 30% if the Pokémon is the last Pokémon to attack this turn

Name: Anger Point
GameText: The Pokémon is angered when it takes a critical hit, and that maxes its Attack stat.
EffectDetail: Increases Attack to maximum level upon taking a critical hit.

Name: Anger Shell
GameText: When an attack causes its HP to drop to half or less, the Pokémon gets angry. This lowers its Defense and Sp. Def stats but boosts its Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats.

Name: Anticipation
GameText: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.
EffectDetail: Warns when the foe knows 1-hit KO or super-effective moves.

Name: Arena Trap
GameText: Prevents opposing Pokémon from fleeing.
EffectDetail: The opponent cannot run nor switch. Flying-type Pokémon and Pokémon with the Levitate special ability are unaffected. If this Pokémon switches, the opponent is still trapped for that turn. The opponent may still switch by using Baton Pass.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a wild Pokémon increases to 200%.

Name: Armor Tail
GameText: The mysterious tail covering the Pokémon's head makes opponents unable to use priority moves against the Pokémon or its allies.

Name: Aroma Veil
GameText: Protects itself and its allies from attacks that limit their move choices.

Name: As One - Unnerve Chilling Neigh
GameText: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it utters a chilling neigh, which boosts its Attack stat. Prevents the opponent from using Berries

Name: As One - Unnerve Grim Neigh
GameText: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it utters a terrifying neigh, which boosts its Special Attack stat. Prevents the opponent from using Berries

Name: Aura Break
GameText: The effects of “Aura” Abilities are reversed to lower the power of affected moves.

Name: Bad Dreams
GameText: Reduces the HP of sleeping opposing Pokémon.

Name: Ball Fetch
GameText: If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch the Poké Ball from the first failed throw of the battle.

Name: Battery
GameText: Powers up ally Pokémon's special moves.Boosts Ally Pokémon's Special Attack by 30%.

Name: Battle Armor
GameText: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.
EffectDetail: Opponent’s moves cannot Critical Hit.

Name: Battle Bond
GameText: Defeating an opposing Pokémon strengthens the Pokémon's bond with its Trainer, and it becomes Ash-Greninja. Water Shuriken gets more powerful.In Scarlet & Violet, changes to boost Attack, Speed and Special Attack when opponents are knocked out.
EffectDetail: When the user knocks out a target, its Attack, Sp. Attack and Speed stats are boosted by 1 stage

Name: Beads of Ruin
GameText: The power of the Pokémon's ruinous beads lowers the Sp. Def stats of all Pokémon except itself.

Name: Beast Boost
GameText: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.
EffectDetail: Increases the Pokémon's highest stat when it knocks out a Pokémon

Name: Berserk
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's Sp. Atk stat when it takes a  hit that causes its HP to become half or less.

Name: Big Pecks
GameText: Protects the Pokémon from Defense-lowering effects.

Name: Blaze
GameText: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.
EffectDetail: When HP is below 1/3rd its maximum, power of Fire-type moves is increased by 50%.

Name: Bulletproof
GameText: Protects the Pokémon from some ball and bomb moves.

Name: Cheek Pouch
GameText: Restores HP as well when the Pokémon eats a Berry.

Name: Chilling Neigh
GameText: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it utters a chilling neigh, which boosts its Attack stat.

Name: Chlorophyll
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in sunshine.
EffectDetail: When sunny, the Pokémon’s Speed doubles.

Name: Clear Body
GameText: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.
EffectDetail: Opponents’ moves which lower this Pokémon’s stats have no effect. However this Pokémon may lower its own stats with its own moves.

Name: Cloud Nine
GameText: Eliminates the effects of weather.
EffectDetail: All weather effects are negated while the Pokémon is on the field.

Name: Color Change
GameText: The Pokémon's type becomes the type of the move used on it.
EffectDetail: This Pokémon’s type becomes the type of the last damaging move which hit it.

Name: Comatose
GameText: It's always drowsing and will never wake up. It can attack without waking up.
EffectDetail: It acts as if it is affected by the Sleep status condition. All special effects of moves based on the Sleep status condition affect this Pokémon such as Snore & Sleep Talk working from the Pokémon with Comatose and double damage from Hex & Wake-up Slap, Dream Eater & Nightmare and even abilities such as Bad Dreams will activate. This Pokémon can still attack.

Name: Commander
GameText: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it goes inside the mouth of an ally Dondozo if one is on the field. The Pokémon then issues commands from there.
EffectDetail: Tatsugiri will go into Dondozo's mouth and be unable to be damaged from attacks. Dondozo can no longer switch out. Dondozo's stats all raise by 2 stages

Name: Competitive
GameText: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat sharply when a stat is lowered.
EffectDetail: Raises Sp. Atk stat by two stages whenever a stat is lowered

Name: Compound Eyes
GameText: The Pokémon's compound eyes boost its accuracy.
EffectDetail: Raises the Pokémon’s accuracy by 30%.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a wild Pokémon holding an item increases.

Name: Contrary
GameText: Makes stat changes have an opposite effect.
EffectDetail: Moves used on the Pokémon that raise stats lower the stats, while the moves that lower the stats raise the stat

Name: Corrosion
GameText: The Pokémon can poison the target even if it's a Steel or Poison type.

Name: Costar
GameText: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it copies an ally's stat changes.

Name: Cotton Down
GameText: When the Pokémon is hit by an attack, it scatters cotton fluff around and lowers the Speed stat of all Pokémon except itself.

Name: Cud Chew
GameText: When the Pokémon eats a Berry, it will regurgitate that Berry at the end of the next turn and eat it one more time.

Name: Curious Medicine
GameText: When the Pokémon  is brought into battle, any stat alterations of allies are removed

Name: Cursed Body
GameText: May disable a move used on the Pokémon.
EffectDetail: When a move hits the Pokémon, that move has a 30% chance of getting disabled

Name: Cute Charm
GameText: Contact with the Pokémon may cause infatuation.
EffectDetail: The opponent has a 30% chance of being induced with Attract when using an attack, that requires physical contact, against this Pokémon.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a wild Pokémon of the opposite gender will be 66.6%. Does not effect swarming Pokémon.

Name: Damp
GameText: Prevents the use of explosive moves such as Self-Destruct by dampening its surroundings.
EffectDetail: Explosion, Selfdestruct, Mind Blown & Misty Explosion will not work while the Pokémon is on the field.

Name: Dancer
GameText: When another Pokémon uses a dance move, it can use a dance move following it regardless of its Speed.

Name: Dark Aura
GameText: Powers up each Pokémon's Dark-type moves.
EffectDetail: Powers up every Pokémon in play's Dark-type moves by 33%

Name: Dauntless Shield
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's Defense stat the first time that the Pokémon enters a battle.

Name: Dazzling
GameText: Surprises the opposing Pokémon, making it unable to attack using priority moves.
EffectDetail: Prevents the opponent from using moves with increased Speed Priority on this Pokémon.

Name: Defeatist
GameText: Halves the Pokémon's Attack and Sp. Atk stats when its HP becomes half or less.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon's Attack & Special Attack is halved when its Hit Points are below 50% of maximum

Name: Defiant
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat sharply when its stats are lowered.
EffectDetail: Attack is raised by two stages when the Pokémon has its stats lowered. Doesn't work on self inflicted stat drops or drops from allies

Name: Delta Stream
GameText: The Pokémon changes the weather to eliminate all of the Flying type's weaknesses.
EffectDetail: Creates the Strong Winds weather. This lasts until the Pokémon exits battle, and weakens moves used on Flying-type Pokémon that would be Super Effective

Name: Desolate Land
GameText: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Water-type attacks.
EffectDetail: Creates the Strong Sun weather. This lasts until the Pokémon exits battle, and renders Water-type moves useless

Name: Disguise
GameText: Once per battle, the shroud that covers the Pokémon can protect it from an attack.
EffectDetail: Once per battle, the Pokémon can withstand one damaging attack without receiving any damage. Damage inflicted through entry hazards, weather or status conditions will not break the disguise. Damage from Confusion will break the Disguise.  It causes 1/8th of max Hit Point damage when it breaks

Name: Download
GameText: Compares an opposing Pokémon's Defense and Sp. Def stats before raising its own Attack or Sp. Atk stat—whichever will be more effective.
EffectDetail: Attack is increased when the foe’s Defense is lower than its Special Defense or increases Special Attack when the foe’s Special Defense is lower than its Defense.

Name: Dragon's Maw
GameText: Powers up Dragon-type moves.
EffectDetail: Increases the damage inflicted by Dragon-type moves by 50%

Name: Drizzle
GameText: The Pokémon makes it rain when it enters a battle.
EffectDetail: Weather changes to Heavy Rain when the Pokémon enters the battle. As of X & Y, this lasts 5 turns.

Name: Drought
GameText: Turns the sunlight harsh when the Pokémon enters a battle.
EffectDetail: Weather changes to Intense Sunshine when the Pokémon enters the battle. As of X & Y, this lasts 5 turns.

Name: Dry Skin
GameText: Restores HP in rain or when hit by Water-type moves. Reduces HP in sunshine, and increases the damage received from Fire-type moves.
EffectDetail: HP is restored when hit by Water-type moves or when it is raining but also makes the Pokémon weak to Fire-type moves and reduces HP during strong sunlight.

Name: Early Bird
GameText: The Pokémon awakens twice as fast as other Pokémon from sleep.
EffectDetail: Sleep conditions lasts for half as long, rounding down. For example, half of three turns is 1.5, which rounds down to one turn. When the number of turns to sleep is one, half of this rounded down is zero, and the Pokémon wakes up instantly.

Name: Earth Eater
GameText: If hit by a Ground-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.
EffectDetail: The user recovers 25% of its maximum Hit Points when a Ground-type move is used against it

Name: Effect Spore
GameText: Contact with the Pokémon may inflict poison, sleep, or paralysis on its attacker.
EffectDetail: The opponent has a 10% chance of being induced by PARALYZE, POISON, or SLEEP when using an attack, that requires physical contact, against this Pokémon.

Name: Electric Surge
GameText: Turns the ground into Electric Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
EffectDetail: Activates Electric Terrain for 5 turns when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Name: Electromorphosis
GameText: The Pokémon becomes charged when it takes damage, boosting the power of the next Electric-type move the Pokémon uses.

Name: Emergency Exit
GameText: The Pokémon, sensing danger, switches out when its HP becomes half or less.
EffectDetail: When the Pokémon's Hit Points hit 50% or less, the Pokémon will switch out. Works once per battle. The Pokémon will not switch out if it drops below 50% due to Confusion, Weather, use of Substitute or when the damage inflicted is by a Pokémon with the Sheer Force ability. It will not activate if health is brought back up above 50% due to a hold item

Name: Fairy Aura
GameText: Powers up each Pokémon's Fairy-type moves.
EffectDetail: Powers up every Pokémon in play's Fairy-type moves by 33%

Name: Filter
GameText: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.
EffectDetail: Damage by super-effective moves is reduced by 25%.

Name: Flame Body
GameText: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.
EffectDetail: The opponent has a 30% chance of being induced with Burn when using an attack, that requires physical contact, against this Pokémon.
OverworldEffect: Eggs hatch quicker (half the number of steps are required).

Name: Flare Boost
GameText: Powers up special attacks when the Pokémon is burned.
EffectDetail: Special Attack stat increased by 50% when burned

Name: Flash Fire
GameText: Powers up the Pokémon's Fire-type moves if it's hit by one.
EffectDetail: Activates when user is hit by a damaging Fire-type move (including Fire-type Hidden Power). Once activated, user’s Fire-type moves deal 1.5 times damage. While this ability is in effect, this Pokémon is immune to damage from Fire-type attacks and Fire-type Hidden Power (accuracy and effect from these moves are ignored). For Fire-type Pokémon with this ability, Will-O-Wisp activates this ability without having an effect. If a non-Fire-type Pokémon has this ability, Will-O-Wisp will activate the ability and will have an effect.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a Fire-type wild Pokémon increases severely.

Name: Flower Gift
GameText: Boosts the Attack and Sp. Def stats of itself and allies when it is sunny.
EffectDetail: Ally’s Attack and Special Defence are multiplied by 1.5 during strong sunlight.

Name: Flower Veil
GameText: Ally Grass-type Pokémon are protected from status conditions and the lowering of their stats.

Name: Fluffy
GameText: Halves the damage taken from moves that make direct contact, but doubles that of Fire-type moves.

Name: Forecast
GameText: The Pokémon transforms with the weather to change its type to Water, Fire, or Ice.
EffectDetail: This Pokémon’ changes its form and type if Harsh Sunlight, Heavy Rain or Snow is in effect.

Name: Forewarn
GameText: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can tell one of the moves an opposing Pokémon has.
EffectDetail: Reveals the foe’s strongest move.

Name: Friend Guard
GameText: Reduces damage done to allies.
EffectDetail: In Double & Triple battles, the damage that ally Pokémon receive from attacks is reduced by 25%.

Name: Frisk
GameText: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.
EffectDetail: Reveals the foe’s held item.

Name: Full Metal Body
GameText: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

Name: Fur Coat
GameText: Halves the damage from physical moves onto this Pokémon.

Name: Gale Wings
GameText: Gives priority to Flying-type moves when the  Pokémon's HP is full.
EffectDetail: All Flying-type moves have their Speed Priority increased by 1 if the Pokémon's Hit Points are at maximum

Name: Galvanize
GameText: Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
EffectDetail: Increases the power of Normal-type moves by 20%. It then changes those moves to Electric-type.

Name: Gluttony
GameText: Makes the Pokémon eat a held Berry when its HP drops to half or less, which is sooner than usual.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon will use a berry when its Hit Points are below 50%.

Name: Good as Gold
GameText: A body of pure, solid gold gives the Pokémon full immunity to other Pokémon's status moves.

Name: Gooey
GameText: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.
EffectDetail: Lowers the opponent's Speed by one stage when it makes physical contact.

Name: Gorilla Tactics
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat but only allows the use of the first selected move.
EffectDetail: Raises the Pokémon's Attack stat by one stage, but locks the Pokémon into using the first attack it uses after being sent out

Name: Grass Pelt
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's Defense stat in  Grassy Terrain.
EffectDetail: Increases Defense by 50% when battling on Grass or if the move Grassy Terrain is in effect

Name: Grassy Surge
GameText: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
EffectDetail: Activates Grassy Terrain for 5 turns when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Name: Grim Neigh
GameText: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it utters a terrifying neigh, which boosts its Special Attack stat.

Name: Guard Dog
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat if intimidated. Moves and items that would force the Pokémon to switch out also fail to work.

Name: Gulp Missile
GameText: When the Pokémon uses Surf or Dive, it will come back with prey. When it takes damage, it will spit out the prey to attack.
EffectDetail: When using Surf or Dive, it will change into Gulping Form if it has over 50% max HP or Gorging Form if it has less than 50% max HP. If hit afterwards, form reverts and it shoots out its prey to attack, doing 1/4th of opponent's maximum HP in damage. If the Cramorant was in Gulping Form, the opponent's Defense is lowered 1 stage. If the Cramorant was in Gorging Form, the opponent is paralyzed.

Name: Guts
GameText: It's so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat.
EffectDetail: Attack is increased by 50% when induced with a status (BURN, PARALYZE, SLEEP, POISON, FREEZE). Burn’s effect of lowering Attack is not applied.

Name: Hadron Engine
GameText: Turns the ground into Electric Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle. The futuristic engine within the Pokémon also boosts its Sp. Atk stat on Electric Terrain.

Name: Harvest
GameText: May create another Berry after one is used.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon has a 50% chance of restoring a consumed berry. During sunshine, this chance increases to 100%
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a Grass-type wild Pokémon increases severely.

Name: Healer
GameText: Sometimes heals an ally's status condition.
EffectDetail: At the end of the turn, there is a 30% chance of either Ally being healed from a status condition

Name: Heatproof
GameText: The heatproof body of the Pokémon halves the damage from Fire-type moves that hit it.
EffectDetail: Damage from Fire-type moves and the Burn status is halved.

Name: Heavy Metal
GameText: Doubles the Pokémon's weight.

Name: Honey Gather
GameText: The Pokémon may gather Honey after a battle.
EffectDetail: May pick up a Honey after battle; the higher the level, the higher the chance.

Name: Huge Power
GameText: Doubles the Pokémon's Attack stat.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon's Attack stat is doubled while it has this ability.

Name: Hunger Switch
GameText: The Pokémon changes its form, alternating between its Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode after the end of each turn.

Name: Hustle
GameText: Boosts the Attack stat, but lowers accuracy.
EffectDetail: Damage from physical attacks is increased by 50%, but average accuracy is only 80%.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a high level wild Pokémon increases by 50%.

Name: Hydration
GameText: Heals status conditions if it's raining.
EffectDetail: All status problems: Burn, Paralysis, Sleep, Frozen and Poison, are healed when raining.

Name: Hyper Cutter
GameText: The Pokémon's proud of its powerful pincers. They prevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.
EffectDetail: Opponent cannot lower this Pokémon’s Attack value. This Pokémon may still lower its own Attack value using a move of by itself.

Name: Ice Body
GameText: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in a Snowstorm.
EffectDetail: HP is restored by 1/16th of maximum HP when its Snowing.

Name: Ice Face
GameText: The Pokémon's ice head can take a physical attack as a substitute, but the attack also changes the Pokémon's appearance. The ice will be restored when it Snows.
EffectDetail: Has a protective barrier that protects against Physical Attacks once and will change form to Noice Face after breaking. Confusion also breaks the barrier. Setting Snow or being sent out during Snow will restore the Ice Face and change form to Ice Face

Name: Ice Scales
GameText: The Pokémon is protected by ice scales, which halve the damage taken from special moves.

Name: Illuminate
GameText: Raises the likelihood of meeting wild Pokémon by illuminating the surroundings.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a wild Pokémon increases to 200%.

Name: Illusion
GameText: Comes out disguised as the Pokémon in the party's last spot.
EffectDetail: When sent out into battle, it takes the name and appearance of the last non-fainted Pokémon within your party. It breaks when an attack does damage on the Pokémon but not from Weather Effects or Entry Hazards.

Name: Immunity
GameText: The immune system of the Pokémon prevents it from getting poisoned.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon cannot be Poisoned while having this ability.

Name: Imposter
GameText: The Pokémon transforms itself into the Pokémon it's facing.
EffectDetail: When sent into battle, the Pokémon automatically transforms into a random opponent that is on the field.

Name: Infiltrator
GameText: Passes through the opposing Pokémon's barrier, substitute, and the like and strikes.
EffectDetail: The protections and stat boosts caused by the moves Substitute, Reflect, Light Screen and Safeguard by the opponent are ignored.

Name: Innards Out
GameText: Damages the attacker landing the finishing hit by the amount equal to its last HP.

Name: Inner Focus
GameText: The Pokémon's intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.
EffectDetail: This Pokémon will not flinch. Does not prevent flinching with Focus Punch. Also prevents stats from being lowered by the ability Intimidate

Name: Insomnia
GameText: The Pokémon is suffering from insomnia and cannot fall asleep.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon cannot be put to Sleep while having this ability.

Name: Intimidate
GameText: The Pokémon intimidates opposing Pokémon upon entering battle, lowering their Attack stat.
EffectDetail: Upon entering battle, the opponent’s Attack lowers one stage. In a Double Battle, both opponents’ Attack are lowered. Pokémon with the Clear Body, Hyper Cutter, or White Smoke ability are unaffected. In a link battle, if both sides switch on the same turn, and first player sends out a Pokémon with Intimidate, the opponent’s Attack will be lowered before the opponent’s Pokémon switches.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a low level wild Pokémon decreases by 50%. This applies to Pokémon five levels lower than or below the level of the lead Pokémon.

Name: Intrepid Sword
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat the first time that the Pokémon enters a battle.

Name: Iron Barbs
GameText: Inflicts damage to the attacker on contact with iron barbs.
EffectDetail: If physical contact is made on this Pokémon, the opponent will receive damage equal to 1/8th of its maximum HP.

Name: Iron Fist
GameText: Powers up punching moves.
EffectDetail: The power of punching moves is increased by 20%.

Name: Justified
GameText: Being hit by a Dark-type move boosts the Attack stat of the Pokémon, for justice.
EffectDetail: Attack is raised by one stage when the Pokémon is hit by a Dark-type move

Name: Keen Eye
GameText: Keen eyes prevent other Pokémon from lowering this Pokémon's accuracy.
EffectDetail: Opponent cannot lower this Pokémon’s accuracy. The Pokémon ignores evasion boosts of the opponent
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a low level wild Pokémon decreases by 50%. This applies to Pokémon five levels lower than or below the level of the lead Pokémon.

Name: Klutz
GameText: The Pokémon can't use any held items.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon cannot receive any effect of hold items except those that affect experience, EVs, friendship etc. such as Amulet Coin, Soothe Bell, Lucky Egg, Exp.Share, Macho Brace or the Power Items.

Name: Leaf Guard
GameText: Prevents status conditions in sunny weather.
EffectDetail: Prevents the Pokémon from being afflicted by status conditions during strong sunlight.

Name: Levitate
GameText: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.
EffectDetail: Damage dealing Ground-type moves have no effect on this Pokémon. Cannot be trapped by Arena Trap ability. Takes no damage from Spikes.

Name: Libero
GameText: Changes the Pokémon's type to the type of the move it's about to use.
EffectDetail: Before the Pokémon uses a move, it becomes a pure Pokémon of that type. This only works once per switch in.

Name: Light Metal
GameText: Halves the Pokémon's weight.

Name: Lightning Rod
GameText: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves.  Instead of being hit by Electric-type moves,  it boosts its Sp. Atk.
EffectDetail: Electric-type moves are drawn to this Pokémon. Electric-type moves will do no damage and the Pokémon's SP ATK is raised one stage.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering an Electric-type wild Pokémon increases severely.

Name: Limber
GameText: Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon cannot be Paralysed while having this ability.

Name: Lingering Aroma
GameText: Contact with the Pokémon changes the attacker's Ability to Lingering Aroma.

Name: Liquid Ooze
GameText: Oozed liquid has strong stench, which damages attackers using any draining move.
EffectDetail: When the opponent absorbs Hit Points from this Pokémon, the opponent instead loses Hit Points.

Name: Liquid Voice
GameText: All sound-based moves become Water-type moves.

Name: Long Reach
GameText: The Pokémon uses its moves without making contact with the target.

Name: Magic Bounce
GameText: Reflects status moves, instead of getting hit by them.
EffectDetail: Reflects non-attacking moves used on the Pokémon back to the attacking Pokémon

Name: Magic Guard
GameText: The Pokémon only takes damage from attacks.
EffectDetail: Prevents all no damage except from direct-attack moves, excluding damage self inflicted from Substitute, Belly Drum, Curse & Pain Split.

Name: Magician
GameText: The Pokémon steals the held item of a Pokémon it hits with a move.

Name: Magma Armor
GameText: The Pokémon is covered with hot magma, which prevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen.
EffectDetail: This Pokémon cannot be Frozen while having this ability.
OverworldEffect: Eggs hatch quicker (half the number of steps are required).

Name: Magnet Pull
GameText: Prevents Steel-type Pokémon from escaping using its magnetic force.
EffectDetail: Steel types cannot run nor switch while this Pokémon is in battle. Because the opponent’s switching is blocked, the opponent cannot switch on the turn this Pokémon switches out of battle. The opponent may still switch with Baton Pass.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a Steel-type wild Pokémon increases severely.

Name: Marvel Scale
GameText: The Pokémon's marvelous scales boost the Defense stat if it has a status condition.
EffectDetail: Defense  is increased by 50% when induced with a status (BURN, PARALYZE, SLEEP, POISON, FREEZE).

Name: Mega Launcher
GameText: Powers up aura and pulse moves.
EffectDetail: Increases the power of Aura and Pulse moves by 50%

Name: Merciless
GameText: The Pokémon's attacks become critical hits if the target is poisoned.

Name: Mimicry
GameText: Changes the Pokémon's type depending on the terrain.
EffectDetail: Changes to Electric-type in Electric Terrain, Psychic-type in Psychic Terrain, Grass-type in Grassy Terrain  and Fairy type in Fairy-terrain. The type reverts to normal when the terrain ends.

Name: Minus
GameText: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.
EffectDetail: When battling with Plus or Minus, Special Attack increases by 50%.

Name: Mirror Armor
GameText: Bounces back only the stat-lowering effects that the Pokémon receives.

Name: Misty Surge
GameText: Turns the ground into Misty Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
EffectDetail: Activates Misty Terrain for 5 turns when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Name: Mold Breaker
GameText: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon's moves are not affected by foe’s abilities during battle

Name: Moody
GameText: Raises one stat sharply and lowers another every turn.
EffectDetail: At the end of every turn, a random stat (except Accuracy and Evasion) is raised by two stages while another is lowered by one stage.

Name: Motor Drive
GameText: Boosts its Speed stat if hit by an Electric-type move, instead of taking damage.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon takes no damage from Electric-type attacks and Speed raises by one level.

Name: Moxie
GameText: The Pokémon shows moxie, and that boosts the Attack stat after knocking out any Pokémon.
EffectDetail: Attack is raised by one stage when the Pokémon knocks out another Pokémon

Name: Multiscale
GameText: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes when its HP is full.
EffectDetail: Reduces damage afflicted to the Pokémon by 50% if at maximum HP

Name: Multitype
GameText: Changes the Pokémon's type to match the Plate or Z-Crystal it holds.

Name: Mummy
GameText: Contact with the Pokémon changes the attacker's Ability to Mummy.

Name: Mycelium Might
GameText: The Pokémon will always act more slowly when using status moves, but these moves will be unimpeded by the Ability of the target.
EffectDetail: If the Pokémon uses a Status move, it will move last in the Speed bracket, but its moves aren't affected by the Ability of the target

Name: Natural Cure
GameText: All status conditions heal when the Pokémon switches out.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon’s status (BURN, PARALYZE, SLEEP, POISON, FREEZE) is healed when withdrawn from battle.

Name: Neuroforce
GameText: Increases the power of supereffective attacks.
EffectDetail: Increases the power of Super Effective moves used by this Pokémon by 25%

Name: Neutralizing Gas
GameText: If the Pokémon with Neutralizing Gas is in the battle, the effects of all Pokémon's Abilities will be nullified or will not be triggered.

Name: No Guard
GameText: The Pokémon employs no-guard tactics to ensure incoming and outgoing attacks always land.
EffectDetail: The accuracy of all moves known by this Pokémon and all Pokémon targeting this Pokémon raises to 100%
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a wild Pokémon increases by 100%.

Name: Normalize
GameText: All the Pokémon's moves become Normal type. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
EffectDetail: All moves known by the Pokémon turn into Normal-type and have a boost in power of 20%.

Name: Oblivious
GameText: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon cannot be under the Attract condition, Intimidated, or be taunted, while having this ability.

Name: Opportunist
GameText: If an opponent's stat is boosted, the Pokémon seizes the opportunity to boost the same stat for itself.

Name: Orichalcum Pulse
GameText: Turns the sunlight harsh when the Pokémon enters a battle. The ancient pulse thrumming through the Pokémon also boosts its Attack stat in harsh sunlight.

Name: Overcoat
GameText: Protects the Pokémon from things like sand, hail, and powder.
EffectDetail: Protects Pokémon from Weather Effects and Powder moves such as Sleep Powder, Poison Powder etc.

Name: Overgrow
GameText: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.
EffectDetail: When HP is below 1/3rd its maximum, power of Grass-type moves is increased by 50%.

Name: Own Tempo
GameText: This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon cannot be Confused while having this ability. Blocks Intimidate

Name: Parental Bond
GameText: Parent and child each attacks.
EffectDetail: Every move used by the Pokémon will hit twice. The damage inflicted by the second hit is reduced to 25%. If the move used is a damaging move, each hit is capable of afflicting Secondary Effects and Critical Hits

Name: Pastel Veil
GameText: Protects the Pokémon and its ally Pokémon from being poisoned.

Name: Perish Body
GameText: When hit by a move that makes direct contact, the Pokémon and the attacker will faint after three turns unless they switch out of battle.

Name: Pickpocket
GameText: Steals an item from an attacker that made direct contact.
EffectDetail: When a Pokémon makes physical contact with the Pokémon, the item of the opponent is stolen.

Name: Pickup
GameText: The Pokémon may pick up the item an opposing Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.
EffectDetail: Has a 10% chance of finding and holding an item after battle. Will not work if this Pokémon is already holding an item. From Black & White, it allows for the user to pick up the item of its opponent or ally if they used up the item in battle.

Name: Pixilate
GameText: Normal-type moves become Fairy-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
EffectDetail: Increases the power of Normal-type moves by 20%. It then changes those moves to Fairy-type.

Name: Plus
GameText: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.
EffectDetail: When battling with Plus or Minus, Special Attack increases by 50%.

Name: Poison Heal
GameText: Restores HP if the Pokémon is poisoned, instead of losing HP.
EffectDetail: HP is restored by 1/8th the maximum HP every turn while the Pokémon has the Poison condition.

Name: Poison Point
GameText: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.
EffectDetail: The opponent has a 30% chance of being induced with Poison when using an attack, that requires physical contact, against this Pokémon.

Name: Poison Touch
GameText: May poison a target when the Pokémon makes contact.
EffectDetail: When the Pokémon attacks its opponents with a move that causes Physical Contact, there is a 30% chance that the target is Poisoned.

Name: Power Construct
GameText: Other Cells gather to aid when its HP becomes half or less. Then the Pokémon changes its form to Complete Forme.

Name: Power of Alchemy
GameText: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.

Name: Power Spot
GameText: Just being next to the Pokémon powers up moves.
EffectDetail: Increases the power of Ally Pokémon's attacks by 30%

Name: Prankster
GameText: Gives priority to a status move.
EffectDetail: Status category moves have their Speed Priority increased by 1. Moves increased by this that are used on Dark-type opponents will fail.

Name: Pressure
GameText: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.
EffectDetail: When this Pokémon is hit by a move, the opponent’s PP lowers by 2 rather than 1.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a high level wild Pokémon increases by 50%.

Name: Primordial Sea
GameText: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Fire-type attacks.
EffectDetail: Creates the Heavy Rain weather. This lasts until the Pokémon exits battle, and renders Fire-type moves useless

Name: Prism Armor
GameText: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.
EffectDetail: Reduces the power of Super Effective moves used against this Pokémon by 25%

Name: Propeller Tail
GameText: Ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon's Abilities and moves that draw in moves.

Name: Protean
GameText: Changes the Pokémon's type to the type of the move it's about to use.
EffectDetail: Before the Pokémon uses a move, it becomes a pure Pokémon of that type. This only works once per switch in.

Name: Protosynthesis
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's most proficient stat in harsh sunlight or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.
EffectDetail: Increases the user's highest stat by 30% (or 50% for Speed) while Sunny Day is activated or if the Booster Energy is attached

Name: Psychic Surge
GameText: Turns the ground into Psychic Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
EffectDetail: Activates Psychic Terrain for 5 turns when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Name: Punk Rock
GameText: Boosts the power of sound-based moves. The Pokémon also takes half the damage from these kinds of moves.
EffectDetail: Increases the damage of Sound based moves by 30%. Reduces damage taken by this Pokémon by Sound based moves by 50%.

Name: Pure Power
GameText: Using its pure power, the Pokémon doubles its Attack stat.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon’s Attack stat is doubled in battle while having this ability.

Name: Purifying Salt
GameText: The Pokémon's pure salt protects it from status conditions and halves the damage taken from Ghost-type moves.

Name: Quark Drive
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's most proficient stat on Electric Terrain or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.
EffectDetail: Increases the user's highest stat by 30% (or 50% for Speed) while Electric Terrain is activated or if the Booster Energy is attached

Name: Queenly Majesty
GameText: Its majesty pressures the opposing Pokémon, making it unable to attack using priority moves.
EffectDetail: Prevents the opponent from using moves with increased Speed Priority on this Pokémon or its allies.

Name: Quick Draw
GameText: Enables the Pokémon to move first occasionally.
EffectDetail: At the start of each turn, this Pokémon has a 30% chance of moving first in the Speed Priority Bracket

Name: Quick Feet
GameText: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon has a status condition.
EffectDetail: Speed is increased by 50% when induced with a status (Burn, Poison, Sleep, Frozen & Paralysis). If Paralysed, the speed drop is ignored.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a wild Pokémon decreases to 50%.

Name: Rain Dish
GameText: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in rain.
EffectDetail: If Heavy Rain weather is in effect, recovers 1/16th max Hit Points at the end of the turn.

Name: Rattled
GameText: Dark-, Ghost-, and Bug-type moves scare the Pokémon and boost its Speed stat.
EffectDetail: Speed is raised by one stage when the Pokémon is hit by a Bug-type, Ghost-type or Dark-type move or is Intimidated

Name: Receiver
GameText: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.

Name: Reckless
GameText: Powers up moves that have recoil damage.
EffectDetail: The power of moves that have recoil damage is increased by 20%.

Name: Refrigerate
GameText: Normal-type moves become Ice-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
EffectDetail: Increases the power of Normal-type moves by 20%. It then changes those moves to Ice-type.

Name: Regenerator
GameText: Restores a little HP when withdrawn from battle.
EffectDetail: When the Pokémon switches out of battle, up to 33.3% of its maximum Hit Points are restored

Name: Ripen
GameText: Ripens Berries and doubles their effect.

Name: Rivalry
GameText: Becomes competitive and deals more damage to Pokémon of the same gender, but deals less to Pokémon of the opposite gender.
EffectDetail: Attack & Special Attack is increased by 25% if the foe is of the same gender; Attack & Special Attack is decreased by 25% if the foe is of the opposite gender.

Name: RKS System
GameText: Changes the Pokémon's type to match the memory disc it holds.

Name: Rock Head
GameText: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.
EffectDetail: Does not receive recoil damage from recoil-causing damages.

Name: Rocky Payload
GameText: Powers up Rock-type moves.
EffectDetail: Increases the power of Rock-type moves used by this Pokémon by 50%

Name: Rough Skin
GameText: This Pokémon inflicts damage with its rough skin to the attacker on contact.
EffectDetail: The opponent is hurt by 1/8th of his maxium Hit Points of recoil when using an attack, that requires physical contact, against this Pokémon.

Name: Run Away
GameText: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.
EffectDetail: Except for trainer battles, can always run from battle. It still cannot switch during Mean Look or Block.

Name: Sand Force
GameText: Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm.
EffectDetail: Ground-type, Rock-type & Steel-type moves have their power increased by 30% in a Sandstorm and will not receive damage

Name: Sand Rush
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a sandstorm.
EffectDetail: Speed is doubled within a sandstorm

Name: Sand Spit
GameText: The Pokémon creates a sandstorm when it's hit by an attack.

Name: Sand Stream
GameText: The Pokémon summons a sandstorm when it enters a battle.
EffectDetail: Sandstorm blows when the Pokémon enters battle. As of X & Y, this lasts 5 turns.

Name: Sand Veil
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's evasion in a sandstorm.
EffectDetail: Raises the Pokémon’s evasion during a sandstorm by one level.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a wild Pokémon during a sandstorm decreases to 50%.

Name: Sap Sipper
GameText: Boosts the Attack stat if hit by a Grass-type move, instead of taking damage.
EffectDetail: Attack is raised by one stage when the Pokémon is hit by a Grass-type move. User receives no damage from Grass-type attacks.

Name: Schooling
GameText: When it has a lot of HP, the Pokémon forms a powerful school. It stops schooling when its HP is low.
EffectDetail: Changes the Pokémon's form when it is Level 20 and has more than 25% Hit Points. When Hit Points drop below 25%, it changes back to Solo Form

Name: Scrappy
GameText: The Pokémon can hit Ghost-type Pokémon with Normal- and Fighting-type moves.
EffectDetail: Allows the Pokémon to hit Ghost-type Pokémon with Normal-type and Fighting-type moves. Blocks Intimidate

Name: Screen Cleaner
GameText: When the Pokémon enters a battle, the effects of Light Screen, Reflect, and Aurora Veil are nullified for both opposing and ally Pokémon.

Name: Seed Sower
GameText: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokémon is hit by an attack.

Name: Serene Grace
GameText: Boosts the likelihood of additional effects occurring  when attacking.
EffectDetail: The chances of a move having a secondary effect is doubled.

Name: Shadow Shield
GameText: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full.
EffectDetail: Reduces damage inflicted on this Pokémon when at max Hit Points by 50%. It is not affected by moves or abilities that would ignore the ability such as Mold Breaker, Moongeist Beam or Sunsteel Strike

Name: Shadow Tag
GameText: This Pokémon steps on the opposing Pokémon's shadow to prevent it from escaping.
EffectDetail: The opponent cannot run nor switch while this Pokémon is in play. The opponent may still switch by using Baton Pass, U-turn or Volt Switch, if it is holding a Shed Shell or is a Ghost-type.

Name: Sharpness
GameText: Powers up slicing moves.
EffectDetail: Increases the power of Slicing moves used by this Pokémon by 50%

Name: Shed Skin
GameText: The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin.
EffectDetail: Every turn, it has a 1 in 3 chance of healing from a status condition (BURN, PARALYZE, SLEEP, POISON, FREEZE).

Name: Sheer Force
GameText: Removes additional effects to increase the power of moves when attacking.
EffectDetail: Moves with a secondary effect are increased in power by 30% but lose their secondary effect

Name: Shell Armor
GameText: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.
EffectDetail: Opponent’s moves cannot Critical Hit.

Name: Shield Dust
GameText: This Pokémon's dust blocks the additional effects of attacks taken.
EffectDetail: Damaging moves used by the opponent will not have an additional effect.

Name: Shields Down
GameText: When its HP becomes half or less, the Pokémon's shell breaks and it becomes aggressive.
EffectDetail: Changes the Pokémon into its Core form when its Hit Points drop below 50%. Before then, it cannot be affected by Status Conditions such as Burn or Paralysis

Name: Simple
GameText: The stat changes the Pokémon receives are doubled.
EffectDetail: The effectiveness of all stat modifications is doubled.

Name: Skill Link
GameText: Maximizes the number of times multi-strike moves hit.
EffectDetail: Moves that attack 2-5 times always hit 5 times.

Name: Slow Start
GameText: For five turns, the Pokémon's Attack and Speed stats are halved.
EffectDetail: Attack and Speed is halved during the first five turns since sent out.

Name: Slush Rush
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a Snowstorm.
EffectDetail: Doubles the Pokémon's Speed when Snow is in effect

Name: Sniper
GameText: Powers up moves if they become critical hits when attacking.
EffectDetail: Power of critical-hit moves is increased to 225% rather than 150%.

Name: Snow Cloak
GameText: Boosts evasion in a Snowstorm.
EffectDetail: Raises the Pokémon’s evasion during a Snowstorm by one level.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a wild Pokémon during a Snowstorm decreases to 50%.

Name: Snow Warning
GameText: The Pokémon summons a Snowstorm when it enters a battle.
EffectDetail: Snowstorm blows when the Pokémon enters battle. As of X & Y, this lasts 5 turns.

Name: Solar Power
GameText: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat in sunny weather, but HP decreases every turn.
EffectDetail: During sunshine, the Pokémon’s Special Attack raises to 1.5 times but HP decreases by 1/8th the maximum HP every turn.

Name: Solid Rock
GameText: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.
EffectDetail: Damage by super-effective moves is reduced by 25%.

Name: Soul-Heart
GameText: Boosts its Sp. Atk stat every time a Pokémon faints.

Name: Soundproof
GameText: Soundproofing of the Pokémon itself gives full  immunity to all sound-based moves.
EffectDetail: Unaffected by sound moves. If this Pokémon switches out with Baton Pass, Perish Song against the switched out will not be nullified.

Name: Speed Boost
GameText: Its Speed stat is boosted every turn.
EffectDetail: Speed increases by one stage at the end of each turn.

Name: Stakeout
GameText: Doubles the damage dealt to the target's replacement if the target switches out.

Name: Stall
GameText: The Pokémon moves after all other Pokémon do.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon always attacks last.

Name: Stalwart
GameText: Ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon's Abilities and moves that draw in moves.

Name: Stamina
GameText: Boosts the Defense stat when hit by an attack.

Name: Stance Change
GameText: The Pokémon changes its form to Blade Forme when it uses an attack move, and changes to Shield Forme when it uses King's Shield.

Name: Static
GameText: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity, so contact with it may cause paralysis.
EffectDetail: The opponent has a 30% chance of being induced with PARALYZE when using an attack, that requires physical contact, against this Pokémon.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering an Electric-type wild Pokémon increases severely.

Name: Steadfast
GameText: The Pokémon's determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.
EffectDetail: Speed raises by one level every time the Pokémon flinches.

Name: Steam Engine
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat drastically if hit by a Fire- or Water-type move.
EffectDetail: When this Pokémon is hit by a Fire-type or Water-type move, its Speed is increased by 6 stages
OverworldEffect: Eggs hatch quicker (half the number of steps are required).

Name: Steelworker
GameText: Powers up Steel-type moves.
EffectDetail: Increases the power of Steel-type moves used by this Pokémon by 50%

Name: Steely Spirit
GameText: Powers up ally Pokémon's Steel-type moves.
EffectDetail: Increases the power of Steel-type moves used by the user or any Ally Pokémon by 50%

Name: Stench
GameText: By releasing stench when attacking, this Pokémon may cause the target to flinch.
EffectDetail: If the Pokémon uses a move that deals damage on the opponent, there is a chance the opponent flinches
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a wild Pokémon decreases to 50%. In Battle Pyramid, it decreases to 75%.

Name: Sticky Hold
GameText: Items held by the Pokémon are stuck fast and cannot be removed by other Pokémon.
EffectDetail: This Pokémon’s item cannot be taken.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, when fishing, Pokémon are easier to catch.

Name: Storm Drain
GameText: Draws in all Water-type moves. Instead of being hit  by Water-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk.
EffectDetail: Water-type moves are drawn to this Pokémon. Water-type moves will do no damage and the Pokémon's SP ATK is raised one stage
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a Water-type wild Pokémon increases severely.

Name: Strong Jaw
GameText: The Pokémon's strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.
EffectDetail: Increases the power of biting moves by 50%

Name: Sturdy
GameText: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon will remain with 1 HP if it was going to be knocked out by a move when at full Hit Points, and it is immune to One Hit KO moves.

Name: Suction Cups
GameText: This Pokémon uses suction cups to stay in one spot to negate all moves and items that force switching out.
EffectDetail: Negates moves that force switching out.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, when fishing, Pokémon are easier to catch.

Name: Super Luck
GameText: The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted.
EffectDetail: Raises the critical-hit ratio of moves by one level.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a wild Pokémon holding an item increases.

Name: Supreme Overlord
GameText: When the Pokémon enters a battle, its Attack and Sp. Atk stats are slightly boosted for each of the allies in its party that have already been defeated.

Name: Surge Surfer
GameText: Doubles the Pokémon's Speed stat on Electric Terrain.

Name: Swarm
GameText: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.
EffectDetail: When HP is below 1/3rd its maximum, power of Bug-type moves is increased by 50%.
OverworldEffect: While travelling, the roar of common wild Pokémon can be heard more often if the Pokémon is in the lead spot.

Name: Sweet Veil
GameText: Prevents itself and ally Pokémon from falling asleep.

Name: Swift Swim
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.
EffectDetail: When rainy, The Pokémon’s Speed doubles.

Name: Sword of Ruin
GameText: The power of the Pokémon's ruinous sword lowers the Defense stats of all Pokémon except itself.

Name: Symbiosis
GameText: The Pokémon passes its item to an ally that has used up an item.
EffectDetail: Passes the Pokémon's hold item to its adjacent ally when that ally consumes its hold item

Name: Synchronize
GameText: The attacker will receive the same status condition if it inflicts a burn, poison, or paralysis to the Pokémon.
EffectDetail: When this Pokémon becomes Poisoned, Paralyzed, or Burned, so does the opponent. However, Fire-type and Water Veil ability Pokémon cannot be Burned, Poison-type and Steel-type and Immunity ability Pokémon cannot be Poisoned, and Limber ability Pokémon cannot be Paralyzed.

Name: Tablets of Ruin
GameText: The power of the Pokémon's ruinous wooden tablets lowers the Attack stats of all Pokémon except itself.

Name: Tangled Feet
GameText: Raises evasion if the Pokémon is confused.
EffectDetail: Pokémon’s evasion raises one level when Confused.

Name: Tangling Hair
GameText: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.
EffectDetail: Lowers opponent's Speed by 1 stage when the opponent makes physical contact with the Pokémon

Name: Technician
GameText: Powers up the Pokémon's weaker moves.
EffectDetail: Moves with a base power of 60 or less are boosted in power by 50%

Name: Telepathy
GameText: Anticipates an ally's attack and dodges it.
EffectDetail: Prevents damage from team-mates during Double and Triple battles

Name: Teravolt
GameText: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

Name: Thermal Exchange
GameText: Boosts the Attack stat when the Pokémon is hit by a Fire-type move. The Pokémon also cannot be burned.

Name: Thick Fat
GameText: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat, which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.
EffectDetail: Fire and Ice-type moves deal 50% damage.

Name: Tinted Lens
GameText: The Pokémon can use “not very effective” moves to deal regular damage.
EffectDetail: The power of “not very effective” moves is doubled.

Name: Torrent
GameText: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.
EffectDetail: When HP is below 1/3rd its maximum, power of Water-type moves is increased by 50%.

Name: Tough Claws
GameText: Powers up moves that make direct contact.
EffectDetail: Increases the power of moves that make physical contact by 30%

Name: Toxic Boost
GameText: Powers up physical attacks when the Pokémon is poisoned.
EffectDetail: Attack stat increased by 50% when Poisoned

Name: Toxic Debris
GameText: Scatters poison spikes at the feet of the opposing team when the Pokémon takes damage from physical moves.

Name: Trace
GameText: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon copies an opposing Pokémon's Ability.
EffectDetail: Ability becomes the same as that of the opponent. Switching this Pokémon out of battle restores its original ability. In a Double/Triple Battle, a random opponent’s ability will be copied.

Name: Transistor
GameText: Powers up Electric-type moves.
EffectDetail: Increases the damage inflicted by Electric-type moves by 50%

Name: Triage
GameText: Gives priority to a healing move.
EffectDetail: Healing moves have +3 Priority when used by this Pokémon.

Name: Truant
GameText: The Pokémon can't use a move the following turn if it uses one.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon cannot use a move in the turn following one where it used a move, even if that move failed.

Name: Turboblaze
GameText: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

Name: Unaware
GameText: When attacking, the Pokémon ignores the target Pokémon's stat changes.
EffectDetail: Foe’s stat modifications are ignored.

Name: Unburden
GameText: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon's held item is  used or lost.
EffectDetail: Speed is doubled once the held item is consumed.

Name: Unnerve
GameText: Unnerves opposing Pokémon and makes them unable to eat Berries.
EffectDetail: The opponent Pokémon will never use their held Berry while the Pokémon is in battle.

Name: Unseen Fist
GameText: The Pokémon can deal damage with moves that make physical contact, even if the target is protected.

Name: Vessel of Ruin
GameText: The power of the Pokémon's ruinous vessel lowers the Sp. Atk stats of all Pokémon except itself.

Name: Victory Star
GameText: Boosts the accuracy of its allies and itself.
EffectDetail: Accuracy for the Pokémon and Allys is raised by 10%

Name: Vital Spirit
GameText: The Pokémon is full of vitality, and that prevents it from falling asleep.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon cannot be Asleep while having this ability.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a high level wild Pokémon increases by 50%.

Name: Volt Absorb
GameText: Restores HP if hit by an Electric-type move, instead of taking damage.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon heals up to 1/4 of its maximum Hit Points when hit with Electric-type moves.

Name: Wandering Spirit
GameText: The Pokémon exchanges Abilities with a Pokémon that hits it with a move that makes direct contact.

Name: Water Absorb
GameText: Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move, instead of taking damage.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon heals up to 1/4 of its maximum Hit Points when hit with Water-type moves.

Name: Water Bubble
GameText: Lowers the power of Fire-type moves done to the Pokémon and prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.
EffectDetail: Decreases Fire-type move power on the Pokémon by 50%. Increases power of Water-type moves used by the Pokémon by 100% before adding STAB. Prevents Burn

Name: Water Compaction
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's Defense stat sharply when hit by a Water-type move.
EffectDetail: Increases Defense by 2 stages every time it is hit by a Water-type move

Name: Water Veil
GameText: The Pokémon is covered with a water veil, which prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.
EffectDetail: This Pokémon cannot be Burned while having this ability.

Name: Weak Armor
GameText: Physical attacks to the Pokémon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Speed stat.
EffectDetail: When hit by an attack, the Pokémon's Defense is lowered by one stage but Speed is increased by two stages.

Name: Well-Baked Body
GameText: The Pokémon takes no damage when hit by Fire-type moves. Instead, its Defense stat is sharply boosted.
EffectDetail: This Pokémon receives no damage when hit by Fire-type moves and boosts its Defense stat by 2 stages

Name: White Smoke
GameText: The Pokémon is protected by its white smoke, which prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.
EffectDetail: Opponents’ moves which lower this Pokémon’s stats have no effect. However this Pokémon may lower its own stats with its own moves.
OverworldEffect: If the Pokémon is in the lead spot, chance of encountering a wild Pokémon decreases to 50%.

Name: Wimp Out
GameText: The Pokémon cowardly switches out when its HP becomes half or less.
EffectDetail: When the Pokémon's Hit Points hit 50% or less, the Pokémon will switch out. Works once per battle. The Pokémon will not switch out if it drops below 50% due to Confusion, Weather, use of Substitute or when the damage inflicted is by a Pokémon with the Sheer Force ability. It will not activate if health is brought back up above 50% due to a hold item

Name: Wind Power
GameText: The Pokémon becomes charged when it is hit by a wind move, boosting the power of the next Electric-type move the Pokémon uses.

Name: Wind Rider
GameText: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat if Tailwind takes effect or if the Pokémon is hit by a wind move. The Pokémon also takes no damage from wind moves.

Name: Wonder Guard
GameText: Its mysterious power only lets supereffective moves hit the Pokémon.
EffectDetail: The Pokémon is only harmed by Super Effective damage, weather effects and condition effects.

Name: Wonder Skin
GameText: Makes status moves more likely to miss.
EffectDetail: Makes non-damaging moves that are targeted at this Pokémon have the accuracy of 50%.

Name: Zen Mode
GameText: Changes the Pokémon's shape when HP is half or less.
EffectDetail: When Hit Points get to 50% of maximum, the Pokémon changes form. The Pokémon reverts back to its standard form if it loses this ability or returns to over 50% of its Hit Points

Name: Zero to Hero
GameText: The Pokémon transforms into its Hero Form when it switches out.
